Residential Interior Design Course– Design for Interiors (Basic)
Residential Interior Design Course– Design for Interiors (Basic)
Learn interior design fundamentals, including themes, concepts and terminologies to improve effective communication and project outcomes.
Interior design often involves complex and diverse concepts, thus a unified understanding among industry professionals is essential to improve communication and project outcomes.

Designers, contractors, and builders need a solid grasp of the fundamentals to ensure cohesive and effective communication in their projects. This course focuses on building a shared visual language and fostering a common knowledge base within the industry. It is tailored to help interior designers and contractors understand the basics of residential interior design, focusing on Singapore homes. The course covers topics in residential interior design themes, concepts and terminologies related to the design and building industry.

Designed as a 3-tiered series—basic, intermediate, and advanced—these courses aim to provide participants with essential knowledge, key concepts, and practical tools to Discover, Design, and Deliver their projects effectively.
The materials provided in the basic tier are designed to be accessible and practical for both beginners and experienced professionals in the industry.
Practitioners and managers within the design and building industry
Managers and executives involved in marketing, branding and advertising
Designers and freelancers in creative fields
Professionals with experience in design, marketing, quality assurance, operations or collaborative partnership
Participants will learn to establish a common language for Singapore homes, the types of homeowners they may encounter and match interior design styles with different personalities.
Topic 2: Types of popular design themes in Singapore

Participants will explore popular design themes used in the local interior design scene, understanding how these themes differ in aesthetics and functionality. Through the use of mood boards, participants will learn to apply colours and materials effectively.
Participants will learn how colours affect an interior space, impact moods and the importance of matching the right colour for each space.

Participants will learn the “Discover, Design and Deliver” approach to work effectively with clients.. They will be taught how to use the 3Ds template to simplify the process of starting a new project.
Assistant Professor , Business, Communication and Design, Singapore Institute of Technology
Assistant Professor , Business, Communication and Design, Singapore Institute of Technology

Mark Teo is an Assistant Professor of Design in the Business, Communication and Design cluster at the Singapore Institute of Technology. He has more than 15 years of experience, straddling practice and higher education, and has practiced in Singapore, Australia, and Canada. Mark is interested in how spaces impact people’s lifestylesand vice versa. He has crafted and overseen projects ranging from small lighting installations to conservation shophouses and multi-unit high-rise residential developments. Mark is a member of the Singapore Institute of Architects and served on the Sustainability Committee in 2009, during which he was a contributor to the institute’s policy paper on the attributes of a sustainable built environment. He is also serving on both the Sustainability Education Committee and the Sustainability Work Group at  the Singapore Institute of Technology. His current research interests are in human-centred design, sustainability, urban agriculture, and food security.

Gyn Kong graduated with a Master of Architecture from the School of Architecture at the National University of Singapore. She started her career specialising in exhibition and retail interior design. Through working on small projects with short completion timeframe at an early stage of her career has enabled her to grasp the full spectrum of handling a design project from design inception to construction. 37 Degree - a casual wear retail chain, The Ninth Vine Wine Academy were some of her earlier works. Gyn joined Alsop Architects in 2003 to work on larger scale retail and mixed-use projects. She was part of the design team for the Clarke Quay redevelopment, and she managed the Alsop Singapore office during the project. Later, she was posted to Beijing to work on a mixed-use project - Raffles City Beijing. She was vital in the design and detailing of the office tower component. Since 2007, she founded Orangeink Design Studio. The range of projects includes master planning, shophouse A&A, and interior design for education institutions, commercial and residential. In the course of her design practice, Gyn was also a part-time design tutor in the architecture school at the National University of Singapore. Gyn is passionate about education and enjoys sharing and imparting knowledge for design of environment to her students.
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the course
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$1,199.00.
Funded under SkillsFuture Mid-Career Enhanced Subsidy (MCES)
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
